newsitem.title: BRAZIL: SOCCER-ROMARIO IN FIGHT AS MATCH ENDS IN CHAOS.
newsitem.headline: SOCCER-ROMARIO IN FIGHT AS MATCH ENDS IN CHAOS.

text.p: Brazil striker Romario was involved in a fight that resembled scenes from a kick-boxing film at the end of Flamengo's 7-0 win over Madureira.
The incident led to a free-for-all in which Flamengo coach and former Brazil international Junior ran onto the pitch and lunged feet first into a Madureira player.

Romario scored twice in Thursday's game, taking his total for Flamengo to 100. The tally includes a large number of goals scored in friendlies and games in the Rio de Janeiro championship, where many of the teams are of poor quality.
But Romario lost his temper in the 87th minute when he began arguing with rival defender Cafezinho.
The two swore at each other. Romario then aimed a kick at Cafezinho, the Madureira player retaliated and Romario then aimed two more higher kicks at his rival, both of which missed.
The two raised their fists before other players intervened, beginnning a brawl in which players, reporters and officials were involved.
At the end, Cafezinho and Junior were sent off and Romario was left with a swollen left eye.
